column1: UX Researcher II - Azure Cloud Experiences
column2: The Azure Cloud Experiences Studio is seeking a motivated and creative UX researcher who s passionate about understanding customers, analyzing data, and excited to know about cloud computing        As a part of a multidisciplinary team, you ll be working on delivering the next generation of experiences for Microsoft Azure      You will have opportunities to leverage a broad array of qualitative and quantitative research methods      As your product team creates new features, you ll help them make decisions based on data and user perspectives      You bring your skills to your fellow collaborators with optimism, curiosity, and an open mind      We are working toward the vision of Azure as the World s Computer, and we need your help        In our team, we believe in the power of inclusion, diversity of ideas, work/life balance, and the joy of solving challenging problems      We help large enterprises use Azure however and wherever they need it - in the cloud or on the edge - all at a huge scale      We strive for a collaborative culture where everyone can flourish and innovate, including in our own approaches to the ever-changing global climate and flexible work      Join us, and you ll be a part of a passionate community of UX professionals, working on one of the most exciting and fastest growing products in the world                 Required Qualifications:              Bachelors Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field          2+ years of experience conducting user research in tech companies with a proven record of having an impact on products.          Experience with a broad range of research methodologies (usability studies, interviews, site visits, surveys, user modeling, card sorting, or related methods).          A presentation of work demonstrating experience delivering UX research that results in product improvements and business impact.              Preferred Qualifications:              Masters or Doctorate Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Computer Science, Technical Communications, Information Science, Information Architecture, User Experience Design, Behavioral Science, Social Sciences, or related field AND 3+ years User Experience Research experience          2+ years of experience within the technology sector and experience in research methods impacting both product direction and detailed experience design.          Coordinating work on multiple products/releases          Ability to work within tight timelines and with excellent project management skills          Technical knowledge of cloud computing, IT, and computer programming          Excellent oral and written communication skills with an ability to effectively communicate rich customer data and articulate the implications of research findings.              Additional Details:            Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.          These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:          This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.            You will collect and analyze UX data for a feature area, then share accessible insights that improve design and engineering processes for that feature area.          You will collaborate in cross-disciplinary research efforts. This will involve mentoring other disciplines, providing research tools, recruiting programs for research, and helping put together large-scale customer learning events.          You will leverage a wide range of research methodologies including usability studies, interviews, surveys, scorecards, competitive benchmarks, clickstream analytics, A/B testing, ethnographic field research, participatory designs, and user modeling.          You will innovate on new methods and practices that contribute to the UX community within Azure and Microsoft.          You will work in an agile development process and juggle multiple deliverables.          You ll need to be detail-oriented and thorough in your approach to research methodology, but flexible enough to work within time and product constraints.          You will need to be a passionate advocate for our users throughout the development process and demonstrate how this leads to business value.
column11: Computer science, Cloud computing, Project management, Agile development, Cloud, Research, microsoft, User experience design, Analytics, Information architecture

column2: Jar is seeking a talented User Researcher to join our Team. If you are intellectually curious to understand your users with an empathetic approach, and are committed to translating data to insights insights to actionable work items, want new challenges daily and impact the lives of hundreds of thousands of users, this is the role for you!      The role will encompass use of the different types of research (quantitative and qualitative) - usability, ethnography, CI, etc You would be also working on documentation of the said research and heuristic Principles        Responsibilities          Distill project goals and research questions along with well-thought-out plans.      Partner with product owners, designers, writers and engineers to scope, plan and execute qualitative research to understand users across the Jar ecosystem.      Provide continuous and actionable insights to the product teams regularly on how the UX can be improved by analysing and summarising the research insights into actionable guidance.      Document and communicate user insights across the company in a structured fashion through written reports, storyboards and presentations.      Conduct user research at every product lifecycle stage, from identifying unmet user needs to conceptualization and prototype validations. This includes conducting user interviews (telephonic) ethnographic field studies, contextual discovery, concept tests, surveys, card sorting, cognitive walkthroughs, VoC studies, and UAT.      Work with product teams on validating the initial hypothesis, running experiments, surveys, and workshops with Users.          Requirements        2-3 years UXR full time / User Research Experience.      Proven record of influencing product direction and strategy with actionable insights.      Experience working in cross-functional teams (eg design, product management etc).      Being a problem-solver. You love finding out youre wrong.      Consuming large amounts of qualitative and quantitative data to constantly refine your assumptions.      Communicating about any questions / problems / ideas / suggestions , asking for feedback and sharing feedback easily.      Proficiency in MS Office, Google Suite.
column11: Product management, User research, Qualitative research, Prototype, Wealth management, Conceptualization, product life cycle, E-commerce, Medical insurance, MS Office

column2: Ignitho Technologies (India) PvtLtd is looking for UI / UX Associate to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     User Research:Assist in conducting user research to understand user behaviors, needs, and preferences     Collaborate with senior UI/UX designers to gather insights that inform design decisions     Wireframing and Prototyping:Contribute to the creation of wireframes and interactive prototypes to visualize the layout and functionality of digital products     Participate in the testing and iteration of prototypes based on user feedback     Visual Design Support:Assist in creating visual design elements, including graphics, icons, and other assets     Work with the design team to maintain consistency in visual style and branding     Interaction Design:Contribute to defining and designing interactive elements and user journeys within digital interfaces     Ensure a seamless and intuitive flow from one interface element to another     Collaboration:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including UI/UX designers, developers, and product managers     Contribute ideas and feedback during design discussions and critiques     Usability Testing:Participate in usability testing sessions to evaluate the effectiveness and user-friendliness of digital products     Assist in analyzing testing results and making recommendations for improvements     Documentation:Contribute to the documentation of design specifications, guidelines, and design systems     Maintain organized files and documentation for design projects
